New Records: Jack Flaherty’s eight earned runs matched a postseason record accomplished by 15 other pitchers in history
Key Match Events: Francisco Alvarez drove home a run with a single
Francisco Lindor tripled home a run
Brandon Nimmo brought Flaherty’s tally to eight runs
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza sensed the team's personality and observed a mix of strong preparation with smiles
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets are here to fight for it
The situation underscored the problem with the Mets’ bullpen
Even an eight-run lead after four innings caused some sweating
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets have their best starter, Sean Manaea, ready to pitch on an extra day of rest for Game 6
The Dodgers will throw a bullpen game
The Mets played tough from the jump
The Mets remain capable of explosive offensive games because of the depth of their lineup
Starling Marte went 4-for-4 with three doubles and continues to look sharp at the plate
Others: Jack Flaherty’s velocity and command were off, allowing the Mets to score eight early runs
The Mets called on their only rested high-leverage arms in the bullpen, Ryne Stanek and Edwin Díaz, for multiple innings each
